text:
Hey Folks. I was trying to understand how to use the `describe()` function on a `ChainDataFrame`. So I used
`chain = mapreduce(c -> sample(model, NUTS(.65),1000), chainscat, 1:3);`
to generate multiple chains. But I can't figure out how to use the `describe` function on the chains. When I try `describe(chain)` that just shows `MCMCChains.ChainDataFrame[,]` . When I try `describe[chain[:,:,1]` that does not work either. So I am missing something in the syntax somewhere.

text: Oh I just used the Tutorial example from the bayesian differential equations post. Let me post that.

text: <@U9JNHB83X> Pluto has some issues displaying the Turing output, so I had to suppress the `mapreduce` output, and then try to manually recover specific things from that `chain`  variable. I can get plots to work, but have not been able to get the coefficient summaries yet.

text: <@U9JNHB83X> thanks for the tip. Seems like I am still running into that Pluto error when I use `summarystats(chain)`. Seems like Pluto has trouble with the table formatting--there is an issue already posted on Pluto Github. Is there another way to get the coefficient out. Like there is the `coeftable` or such. I should just be able to get the mean of the parameter value, but I was not sure how to intex into the chain type.
